subject: Design
title: Windows 95: The Start Menu Conquers the World
description: A 60-second lesson on Windows 95: The Start Menu Conquers the World.

hook.text: On August 24, 1995, people lined up at midnight to buy an operating system. That's how big it was.

buildup.text: Windows 95 introduced the Start button, the taskbar, and the concept of minimizing windows.

discovery.text: For the first time, normal people could find programs without memorizing commands.

twist.text: Microsoft hired a usability team that watched real people struggle. The Start button was born from pain.

climax.text: Windows 95 brought one billion people to graphical computing. The GUI went truly mainstream.

punchline.text: The Start button taught the world to click.

quiz.question: What key UI element did Windows 95 introduce?
